response:
Immediate neuroimaging is critical to differentiate ischaemic stroke from haemorrhage or mass lesions. Vascular imaging is essential to assess for vertebral artery dissection or basilar occlusion. Swallow assessment is mandatory due to bulbar involvement (IX/X/XII palsies).
